name: DeployAzureResourceGroup
description: Provision and Deploy an Azure Resource Group
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure subscription under which the Resource Group is deployed.

inputs.name: csmFile
inputs.label: Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path to the Azure Resource Manager template.

inputs.name: csmParametersFile
inputs.label: Template Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path for the parameters corresponding to the template.

inputs.name: overrideParameters
inputs.label: Override Template Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the template parameters which should be overwritten in the format -name $variable, where $variable is the name of a build definition variable

inputs.name: dscDeployment
inputs.label: Generate SAS token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Generates SAS token for the Azure blob that is used in the template. Useful if the SAS token expires quickly.

inputs.name: moduleUrlParameterName
inputs.label: Azure Blob Parameter
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the parameter corresponding to the Azure blob.

inputs.name: sasTokenParameterName
inputs.label: SAS Token Parameter
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the SAS token parameter.

inputs.name: vmCreds
inputs.label: Virtual Machine Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: These VM resource's credentials are used by some of the deployment and test tasks. The username and password should be same for all the Virtual Machines.

inputs.name: winrmListeners
inputs.label: WinRM Listeners
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the WinRM HTTP or HTTPS ports and listeners on the Azure Windows VMs to run PowerShell commands on them from a remote machine.

inputs.name: certificatePath
inputs.label: Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the certificate to install on the VMs for WinRM HTTPS. Variables like $(Build.Repository.LocalPath) and wildcards like `**\*.pfx` can be also used.

inputs.name: certificatePassword
inputs.label: Certificate Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password for the certificate that is required to install the certificate on the VMs.

inputs.name: azureKeyVaultName
inputs.label: Azure Key Vault Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Key Vault for uploading the certificate. If no name is provided then a Key Vault name will be generated automatically.

inputs.name: azureKeyVaultSecretName
inputs.label: Azure Key Vault Secret Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The secret name for the certificate in the Key Vault. Used to retrieve the certificate from the Key Vault. If no name is provided then a Secret name will be generated automatically.
